basics.name: Adam Graham
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: I am pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Mānoa's Department of Information and Computer Sciences. Additionally, I am working towards a secondary major in Spanish & Latin American Studies at the College of Arts, Languages & Letters. I expect to graduate in Spring 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
University of Hawaii at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Prep materials and quality control during microfilming process
highlights: Managed collation of hundreds of newspapers, ensuring accurate data collation for multiple titles, streamlining future access and retrieval
Coordinated the preparation of computer-generated targets for microfilming, ensuring timely project completion and vendor collaboration each fiscal year
Prepared and shipped newspaper boxes with associated data to contract vendor, ensuring efficient and timely processing
Performed quality control checks on microfilm shipments, cross-referencing data for accuracy to meet contract deadlines
Onboarded and trained students in the microfilm processes, providing instruction, feedback, and support

awards.title: Linda Rudoy Memorial Spanish Scholarship Endowment
awards.summary: The purpose of this Fund is to assist undergraduate or graduate students seeking a degree in Spanish at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa College of Languages, Linguistics and Literatures of Europe and the Americas. Funds are intended for costs related to attendance and overseas study as approved by the Spanish Division.

awards.title: Mānoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: The Mānoa Academic Merit Scholarship is an automatic scholarship for first-time, degree-seeking students who enroll at UH Mānoa the following Fall semester after high school graduation and have demonstrated outstanding academic achievement. Students must be enrolled for a full-time course load of UH Mānoa credits.

awards.title: Chenter Foundation Susana & Jorge Ho Next Steps Scholarship
awards.summary: The purpose of this Fund is to provide scholarship support to students enrolled at any University of Hawaii campus. Funds shall be used for costs associated with attendance (e.g. tuition, books, fees, etc.).

awards.title: University of Hawaii at Mānoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean’s List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade (C/NC courses do not count), and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester.
